metadata.title: CVE-2022-45420 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
Use tables inside of an iframe, an attacker could have caused iframe contents to be rendered outside the boundaries of the iframe, resulting in potential user confusion or spoofing attacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 102.5, Thunderbird < 102.5, and Firefox < 107.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45420` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: mozjs78 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1').
